title: Pompeo Cancels Party for Ambassadors After Coronavirus Exposure
sub_head: Secretary of state goes into quarantine after unspecified encounter, State Department says
body:
Secretary of State Mike Pompeo canceled a holiday reception with foreign ambassadors on Wednesday after he was exposed to someone who tested positive for Covid-19, according to a State Department official and a diplomat who was invited to the event.
A State Department spokesman said Mr. Pompeo would go into quarantine after coming into contact with the unidentified person who had tested positive. “The secretary has been tested and is negative,” the spokesman said. “He is being closely monitored by the department’s medical team.”
Despite concerns about holiday gatherings due to the surging coronavirus pandemic in the U.S., Mr. Pompeo maintained a holiday social calendar that included a reception on Tuesday for certain State Department family members and Wednesday’s gathering for ambassadors. The department spokesman declined to comment on when Mr. Pompeo was exposed.
The department sent out a statement noting Mr. Pompeo’s exposure at about 10 a.m. Wednesday. An Asian ambassador said he received a notice from the State Department at about 1 p.m. saying the reception was postponed, with no reason given.
The State Department spokesman declined to comment on the cancelation of the event.
